duck: Stage direction, also called theater direction

Direction

direction definition: guidance or supervision of action or conduct.
Directions (delegated legislation), a form of delegated legislation
Direction (geometry) - Direction is the information contained in the relative position of one point with respect to another point without the distance information.
Writing direction
Directions (Norman Blake album), 1978
Directed set, in order theory
Directions: The Plans Video Album, a DVD video album made of videos inspired by songs from indie rock/pop band Death Cab for Cutie's album Plans

Merriam-Webster
Compass direction - Boxing the compass is the action of naming all thirty-two clockwise points of the compass in order.
Relative direction, for instance left, right, forward, backwards, up, and down (see also Anatomical terms of location for those used in scientific descriptions)
Directionality (molecular biology), the orientation of a nucleic acid
Film direction, the filmmaker who is in charge of the making of the visual medium
Direction (record label), a record label in the UK in the late 1960s, a subsidiary of CBS Records, specialising in soul music
Directed graph, in graph theory
Directions (PC Quest album), 1992
Direction – Social Democracy, a major political party in Slovakia

wiki.text:
'Direction' may refer to: *Direction (geometry) **Relative direction, for
instance left, right, forward, backwards, up, and down (see also Anatomical
terms of location for those used in scientific descriptions) **Compass direction
*Film direction, the filmmaker who is in charge of the making of the visual
medium *Stage direction, also called theater direction *Writing direction *See
Alexander technique for Direction, a concept in the Alexander Technique
*Direction – Social Democracy, a major political party in Slovakia *Direction
(record label), a record label in the UK in the late 1960s, a subsidiary of CBS
Records, specialising in soul music *''Direction'' (song), a 1994 7" single by
American indie rock band Heavens to Betsy
* [[Directions: The Plans Video Album]], a DVD video album made of videos
  inspired by songs from indie rock/pop band Death Cab for Cutie's album Plans
* Directed set, in order theory
* Directed graph, in graph theory
* "Direction", a song by the band Interpol, released as a B-side off the [[Six
  Feet Under (soundtrack)|Six Feet Under]] soundtrack *For the guidance and
  cueing of a group of musicians during performance, see conducting
* ''Direction'' (album) a 2007 album by The Starting Line
* Directionality (molecular biology), the orientation of a nucleic acid
* Directions (delegated legislation), a form of delegated legislation
* ''Directions'' (Miles Davis album), 1981
* ''Directions'' (PC Quest album), 1992
* ''Directions'' (Norman Blake album), 1978
wiki.title: Direction
